section.heading: Street harassment prevention report; model policies; public information campaign.

para.text: No later than September 30, 2019, the ACSH shall submit a report to the Mayor and Council that:
Identifies categories of District employees and District residents most at risk of street harassment;

Proposes model policies and training materials to be adopted by District agencies for preventing and responding to street harassment, including model policies and training materials for public-facing employees;
Proposes strategies to improve public awareness and understanding of street harassment;
Discusses the need, if any, for a process by which victims and witnesses of street harassment can report instances of street harassment to District agencies; and
Summarizes any actions taken by the ACSH after October 30, 2018.
No later than April 1, 2020, all District agencies shall:
Implement the model policies developed pursuant to subsection (a) of this section; and
Integrate training materials developed pursuant to subsection (a) of this section into the training of District employees.
Monitor District agencies' implementation of the model policies developed pursuant to subsection (a) of this section; and
No later than September 30, 2019, conduct a public information campaign about street harassment and resources available in the District for victims of street harassment.
